messages.content: ComfyUI-Coziness is a collection of custom nodes for ComfyUI, including MultiLora Loader and Lora Text Extractor.
There are two options to install ComfyUI-Coziness: 1) Add MultiLoraLoader.py to ComfyUI's custom_nodes directory, or 2) Clone the repo into the custom_nodes directory and restart ComfyUI.
What update was made to ComfyUI-Coziness on 2024/2/22?
On 2024/2/22, support was added for connecting Lora Text Extractor directly to Efficiency Nodes for ComfyUI's lora stack inputs.
What is the purpose of MultiLora Loader in ComfyUI-Coziness?
MultiLora Loader in ComfyUI-Coziness uses a textual description to specify the loras you want to add to a checkpoint model.
How can you specify file names in MultiLora Loader?
There are two ways to specify file names in MultiLora Loader: using the full subpath or just the file name itself.
What is the purpose of Lora Text Extractor in ComfyUI-Coziness?

Lora Text Extractor in ComfyUI-Coziness takes input text and extracts loras specified using Automatic1111's lora syntax out of it, providing two outputs: filtered text without loras and extracted loras.
How can you connect Lora Text Extractor to other nodes in ComfyUI?

To connect Lora Text Extractor to other nodes in ComfyUI, you have to convert their text boxes into inputs by right-clicking on each node (CLIP Text Encode and MultiLora Loader) and selecting 'Convert text to input' from the menu.
